intro: Tragia bracteata, commonly known as the bracted tragia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, the Americas, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces, and its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Tragia bracteata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties remain under study.
